question: Which one of the following is NOT an animal sterol? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an animal sterol? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Yam Plant ($Dioscorea$) produces a steroid compound called diosgenin. It is used in the manufacture of antifertility pills. i.e. birth control pills.

question: Disaccharides are formed from two monosaccharides by the process of
question_latex: Disaccharides are formed from two monosaccharides by the process of
solution: Two monosaccharide are linked with each other by formation of Glycosidic bond and removal of water (condensation).

question: Enzymes are most functional at the temperature range of
question_latex: Enzymes are most functional at the temperature range of
solution: Enzymes are most functional at the temperature range of $30^{\circ}-50^{\circ}C$.

question: Sugar and amino acids are
question_latex: Sugar and amino acids are
solution: Sugar and amino acids are primary metabolites. Sugars are building blocks of starch, glycogen, etc., while amino acids are the building blocks of proteins.

question: Richest energy compound is
question_latex: Richest energy compound is
solution: Creatine phosphate is a reservoir of high energy phosphate in muscle cells, as the energy released by its hydrolysis is greater than ATP. Fat contains more energy as compared to carbohydrate and protein.

question: Match lipids given in Column I with their occurrence in Column II. (a) Cerebrosides, (b) Waxes, (c) Diosgenin, (d) Cholesterol. (i) Most of the cells in animal body, (ii) Dioscorea, (iii) Myelin sheath, (iv) Sebaceous glands of the skin
question_latex: Match lipids given in Column I with their occurrence in Column II. (a) Cerebrosides, (b) Waxes, (c) Diosgenin, (d) Cholesterol. (i) Most of the cells in animal body, (ii) Dioscorea, (iii) Myelin sheath, (iv) Sebaceous glands of the skin
solution: Match the columns with biomolecules and the regions where they are found in body. (a)-(iii) Cerebrosides-Myelin sheath, (b)-(iv) Waxes-Sebaceous glands, (c)-(ii) Diosgenin-Dioscorea, (d)-(i) Cholesterol-Most of the cells.

question: The pyrimidine base, which confers additional stability to DNA over RNA, is
question_latex: The pyrimidine base, which confers additional stability to DNA over RNA, is
solution: In DNA, thymine (5 methyl uracil) is present. Uracil is present in RNA at the place of thymine.

question: The enzymes get denatured
question_latex: The enzymes get denatured
solution: All enzymes are proteins. On heating proteins lose their 3-D shape and gets denatured at higher temperature $60^{\circ}$.

question: Identify the INCORRECT statement with reference to enzymes. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Identify the INCORRECT statement with reference to enzymes. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Lock and key analogy for enzyme action is proposed by Emil Fischer.
B. Increase in substrate concentration decreases the velocity of enzyme activity.
C. Protease is a purely proteinaceous enzyme.
D. Induced Fit model for enzyme action is proposed by Koshland.
answer: B. Increase in substrate concentration decreases the velocity of enzyme activity.
solution: Increase in substrate concentration increases the velocity of enzyme activity within a limited range of substrate level.

question: Arrange the steps of catalytic action of an enzyme in order and choose the correct option. I. The enzyme releases the products of the reaction and the enzyme is free for another substrate. II. The active site of enzyme is in close proximity of the substrate and breaks of chemical bonds of the substrate. III. The binding of substrate induces the enzyme to alter its shape fitting more tightly around the substrate. IV. The substrate binds to the active site of the enzyme fitting into the active site.
question_latex: Arrange the steps of catalytic action of an enzyme in order and choose the correct option. I. The enzyme releases the products of the reaction and the enzyme is free for another substrate. II. The active site of enzyme is in close proximity of the substrate and breaks of chemical bonds of the substrate. III. The binding of substrate induces the enzyme to alter its shape fitting more tightly around the substrate. IV. The substrate binds to the active site of the enzyme fitting into the active site.
solution: iv) Part of enzyme where substrate molecules gets attached is known as active site. iii) Induced-fit model stated that when the substrate comes in contact with the active site, the active site modulates according to the shape of the substrate. ii) Active site breaks chemical bonds. i) Enzyme releases products.

question: A protein is a sequence of amino acids. The end of polypeptide chain of $-NH_{2}$ end and at $-COOH$ end are respectively called
question_latex: A protein is a sequence of amino acids. The end of polypeptide chain of $-NH_{2}$ end and at $-COOH$ end are respectively called
options: D. C - terminal and N - terminal
solution: In polypeptide chain end with $NH_{2}$ is called N-terminal and other end with $-COOH$ is called C-terminal.

question: Select the wrong statement
question_latex: Select the wrong statement
options: A. Proteins are heteropolymers made of amino acids
B. Ribozymes are nucleic acids with catalytic power
C. Nucleic acids serve as genetic material
D. Collagen is the most abundant protein in the whole of the biosphere and Rubisco is the most abundant proteins in animal world
answer: D. Collagen is the most abundant protein in the whole of the biosphere and Rubisco is the most abundant proteins in animal world
solution: Collagen is the most abundant protein in animal world and Ribulose bisphosphate carboxylase-oxygenase (RUBISCO) is the most abundant protein in the whole of the biosphere.

question: Compounds with simple sugar, two molecules of fatty acids and glycerol are called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Compounds with simple sugar, two molecules of fatty acids and glycerol are called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Compound lipids are esters of fatty acids containing other groups like phosphate, sugars etc. Sugar-containing lipids are glycolipids.

question: The catalytic efficiency of two different enzymes can be compared by the
question_latex: The catalytic efficiency of two different enzymes can be compared by the
options: D. Molecular size of the enzyme
solution: The catalytic efficiency of two different enzymes can be compared by the $K_{m}$ value.

question: Diosgenin obtained from yam plant ($Dioscorea$) is used in the manufacturing of ..[2022]
question_latex: Diosgenin obtained from yam plant ($Dioscorea$) is used in the manufacturing of ..[2022]
solution: Diosgenin obtained from yam plant ($Dioscorea$) is used in the manufacturing of birth control pills.

question: Chemical compounds which are found in the acid insoluble fraction are called
question_latex: Chemical compounds which are found in the acid insoluble fraction are called
solution: Chemical compounds, which are found in the acid insoluble fraction are called biomacromolecules or macromolecules

question: Which of these is not a ketone body?
question_latex: Which of these is not a ketone body?
solution: Ketone bodies include acetone, acetoacetate and betahydroxy butyric acid. Succinic acid is a TCA cycle intermediate.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an aldose sugar?[2022]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an aldose sugar?[2022]
solution: Fructose is a ketose sugar. Glucose, Glyceraldehyde and Xylose are aldose sugars.

question: Which one of the following is a phospholipid with nitrogenous compound attached to the phosphate group? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is a phospholipid with nitrogenous compound attached to the phosphate group? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Some phospholipids such as lecithin also have a nitrogenous compound attached to the phosphate group.

question: A nucleotide has three chemically distinct compounds. These are A, B and C Choose the correct option for A, B and C
question_latex: A nucleotide has three chemically distinct compounds. These are A, B and C Choose the correct option for A, B and C
options: C. A-Heterocyclic compound, B-Monosaccharide, C-a phosphate
answer: C. A-Heterocyclic compound, B-Monosaccharide, C-a phosphate
solution: A nucleotide has three components: a heterocyclic compound (nitrogen base), a monosaccharide (pentose sugar), and a phosphate or phosphoric acid.

question: Enzymes catalyses the biochemical reactions by the activation energy
question_latex: Enzymes catalyses the biochemical reactions by the activation energy
solution: Enzymes catalyses the biochemical reactions by lowering the activation energy

question: Which one of the following is a simple protein? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one of the following is a simple protein? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Histones is a simple protein made of only amino acids.

question: Who proposed the lock and key model to explain enzyme substrate reaction?[2022]
question_latex: Who proposed the lock and key model to explain enzyme substrate reaction?[2022]
solution: Emil Fischer proposed the lock and key model.

question: The general molecular formula for Monosaccharides is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The general molecular formula for Monosaccharides is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The general molecular formula for Monosaccharides is $(CH_{2}O)_{n}$ in which C: H: O in ratio 1:2:1.

question: The fastest acting enzyme, in the biological kingdom, is
question_latex: The fastest acting enzyme, in the biological kingdom, is
solution: Carbonic anhydrase is found in red blood cells. This is the fastest acting enzyme.

question: Amino acids the substituted methanes. Name the four substituent groups occupying the four valency positions
question_latex: Amino acids the substituted methanes. Name the four substituent groups occupying the four valency positions
options: A. Hydrogen, carboxyl group, amino group and a variable group (R)
B. Two carboxyl groups amino group and OH
C. Two hydrogen, one carboxyl group, amino group and a variable group (R)
D. Two amino groups, one hydrogen and one carboxyl group
answer: A. Hydrogen, carboxyl group, amino group and a variable group (R)
solution: Amino acids are substituted methanes, there are four substituent groups occupying the four valency positions: hydrogen, carboxyl group, amino group and a variable group (R).

question: The molecular weight of hemoglobin is ___ Daltons. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The molecular weight of hemoglobin is ___ Daltons. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Total weight of tetramer is about 64000 Dalton. Nearest option is 68000.

question: Proteins attached with a prosthetic group are called ___ proteins.
question_latex: Proteins attached with a prosthetic group are called ___ proteins.
solution: Proteins attached with prosthetic group are conjugated proteins. Like Nucleoproteins, lipoproteins etc.

question: Choose the type of enzyme involved in the following reaction: $S-G + S' \rightarrow S + S'-G$
question_latex: Choose the type of enzyme involved in the following reaction: $S-G + S' \rightarrow S + S'-G$
solution: Transferases catalyze transfer of group G (other than hydrogen) between a pair of substrates, S and S'.

question: Sterols are found in plants mainly in the form of ....... [2022]
question_latex: Sterols are found in plants mainly in the form of ....... [2022]
solution: Sterols found in plants are called phytosterols.

question: Match types of enzymes in Column I with examples in Column II. A. Purely proteinaceous enzyme (III); B. Organic co-enzyme (IV); C. Transferase enzyme (I); D. Isomerase enzyme (II). Examples: I. glucokinase, II. epimerase, III. protease, IV. FMN.
question_latex: Match types of enzymes in Column I with examples in Column II. A. Purely proteinaceous enzyme (III); B. Organic co-enzyme (IV); C. Transferase enzyme (I); D. Isomerase enzyme (II). Examples: I. glucokinase, II. epimerase, III. protease, IV. FMN.
solution: Purely proteinaceous-Protease; Organic co-enzyme-FMN; Transferase-glucokinase; Isomerase-epimerase.

question: Choose the correct option representing X and Y in the given graph of activation energy.
question_latex: Choose the correct option representing X and Y in the given graph of activation energy.
options: A. X-Activation energy without enzymes, Y-Activation energy with enzyme
B. X- Activation energy with enzyme, Y-Activation energy without enzyme
C. X-Substrate concentration with enzyme, Y-Substrate concentration without enzyme
D. X-Substrate concentration without enzyme, Y-Substrate concentration with enzyme
answer: B. X- Activation energy with enzyme, Y-Activation energy without enzyme
solution: The amount of activation energy in the presence of an enzyme (X) is very less compared to the amount needed in the absence of enzymes (Y).

question: The figure given below shows three velocity substrate concentration curves for an enzyme reaction. What do the curves A, B and C depict respectively?
question_latex: The figure given below shows three velocity substrate concentration curves for an enzyme reaction. What do the curves A, B and C depict respectively?
options: A. A-normal enzyme reaction, B-competitive inhibition, C-non-competitive inhibition
B. A-enzyme with an allosteric modulator added, B-normal enzyme activity, C-competitive inhibition
C. A-enzyme with an allosteric stimulator, B-competitive inhibitor added, C- normal enzyme reaction
D. A- normal enzyme reaction, B-non-competitive inhibitor added, C- allosteric inhibitor added
answer: A. A-normal enzyme reaction, B-competitive inhibition, C-non-competitive inhibition
solution: Curve A: normal enzyme reaction; Curve B: competitive inhibition (Vmax reached at high [S]); Curve C: non-competitive inhibition (Vmax lowered).

question: 'Heme' in hemoglobin represents [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: 'Heme' in hemoglobin represents [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: In haemoglobin Globin is the protein and the iron containing pigment haem is the prosthetic group.

question: Carbohydrates, the most abundant biomolecules earth, are produced by
question_latex: Carbohydrates, the most abundant biomolecules earth, are produced by
options: A. All bacteria, fungi and algae
B. Fungi, algae and green plant cells
C. Some bacteria, algae and green plant cells
answer: C. Some bacteria, algae and green plant cells
solution: Carbohydrates are the products of photosynthesis, which is carried out by photosynthetic bacteria, green algae and green plant cells.

question: Adult human haemoglobin consists of
question_latex: Adult human haemoglobin consists of
solution: Adult human haemoglobin consists of 4 subunits ($2\alpha, 2\beta$).

question: Hydrolysis of lipid yields?
question_latex: Hydrolysis of lipid yields?
solution: Lipid is a fat, which on hydrolysis forms fatty acids and glycerol.

question: Which is an organic compound found in most cells?
question_latex: Which is an organic compound found in most cells?
solution: Glucose ($C_{6}H_{12}O_{6}$) is an organic compound (carbohydrate), which is found in most of the cells.

question: The number of proteins in an average human cell is over ___ [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The number of proteins in an average human cell is over ___ [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Number of proteins in average in human cell is 1,00,000.

question: Which of the following is the example of structural protein?
question_latex: Which of the following is the example of structural protein?
solution: Myosin, Collagen, and Keratin are structural proteins.

question: Example of a typical homopolysaccharide is
question_latex: Example of a typical homopolysaccharide is
solution: Homopolysaccharides contain a single type of monomers, eg., starch, glycogen, cellulose, etc.

question: Secondary metabolites like glucosinolates are produced by cabbage to [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Secondary metabolites like glucosinolates are produced by cabbage to [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Protect it from many pests
answer: A. Protect it from many pests
solution: Glucosinolates protect these plants from many pests.

question: Which of the following polysaccharide is present as a store house of energy in plant tissues?
question_latex: Which of the following polysaccharide is present as a store house of energy in plant tissues?
solution: Starch is present as a store house of energy in plant tissues

question: Starch can be used as an indicator for the detection of traces of
question_latex: Starch can be used as an indicator for the detection of traces of
solution: Starch can be used as an indicator for the detection of traces of iodine in aqueous solution.

question: The bond used in joining simple sugar is ___ bond. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The bond used in joining simple sugar is ___ bond. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The bond used in joining simple sugar is glycosidic bond formed by loss of one molecule of water.

question: Pleated sheet structure of proteins are very well exhibited in [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Pleated sheet structure of proteins are very well exhibited in [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Pleated sheet structure of proteins are very well exhibited in silk fibres.

question: The $\beta$-pleated sheet structure found in proteins is due to
question_latex: The $\beta$-pleated sheet structure found in proteins is due to
options: A. Linking together of two or more polypeptides
D. Folding of the coiled polypeptide chains
answer: A. Linking together of two or more polypeptides
solution: Two or more polynucleotide chains may join together by intermolecular hydrogen bonds and may bend into parallel folds to form $\beta$-pleated sheet

question: A bond formed between carboxyl group of one amino acid and amino group of adjacent amino acid, is called
question_latex: A bond formed between carboxyl group of one amino acid and amino group of adjacent amino acid, is called
solution: A peptide bond is a chemical bond formed between two molecules when the carboxyl group of one molecule reacts with the amino group of the other molecule.

question: In nucleic acid, nitrogen base is attached to the ___ carbon atom of a sugar. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In nucleic acid, nitrogen base is attached to the ___ carbon atom of a sugar. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: In nucleic acid, nitrogen base is attached to the first carbon atom of a sugar and P group is to fifth carbon of sugar.

question: In a protein molecule, the amino acid units are linked together by ... bonds formed between the amino acid units and the carboxyl group of successive amino acids
question_latex: In a protein molecule, the amino acid units are linked together by ... bonds formed between the amino acid units and the carboxyl group of successive amino acids
solution: In a protein molecule, the amino acid units are linked together by peptide bonds.

question: An example of competitive inhibition of an enzyme is the inhibition of
question_latex: An example of competitive inhibition of an enzyme is the inhibition of
options: A. Succinic dehydrogenase by malonic acid
D. Carbonic anhydrase by carbon dioxide
answer: A. Succinic dehydrogenase by malonic acid
solution: Classical example of competitive inhibition is reduction of activity of succinate dehydrogenase by malonate, oxaloacetate and other anions.

question: A product of metabolism is called a
question_latex: A product of metabolism is called a
solution: A product of metabolism is called a metabolite

question: Which of the following is an isozyme?
question_latex: Which of the following is an isozyme?
solution: LDH (Lactic dehydrogenase) is a good example of isoenzymes

question: In a polysaccharide, the individual monosaccharides are linked by a
question_latex: In a polysaccharide, the individual monosaccharides are linked by a
solution: Linkage between adjacent monosaccharides is through glycosidic bonds (-C-O-C-).

question: Which of the following statement(s) are/is correct? I. Metabolism is built up; II. Metabolite always called metabolite; III. Build up building built up; IV. Metabolism characteristic of non-living things.
question_latex: Which of the following statement(s) are/is correct? I. Metabolism is built up; II. Metabolite always called metabolite; III. Build up building built up; IV. Metabolism characteristic of non-living things.
options: D. II and IV are correct
solution: All statements are incorrect. Metabolism is features of living beings.

question: Increase in substrate concentration ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Increase in substrate concentration ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Always decreases the velocity of enzyme activity.
B. Always increases the rate of enzyme action.
C. Initially increases the velocity of enzyme activity.
D. Neither decreases nor increases enzyme activity.
answer: C. Initially increases the velocity of enzyme activity.
solution: Increase in substrate concentration initially increases the velocity of enzyme activity within a limited range of substrate level.

question: Choose the correct statements regarding enzymes. I. All are proteinaceous; II. More active at 70C; III. Active sites where substrate binds; IV. Activity enhanced at any pH; V. Enzymes remain active after reaction. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Choose the correct statements regarding enzymes. I. All are proteinaceous; II. More active at 70C; III. Active sites where substrate binds; IV. Activity enhanced at any pH; V. Enzymes remain active after reaction. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: B. II, III and V only
C. I, III and V only
answer: C. I, III and V only
solution: Statement II and IV are incorrect. Most enzymes are proteins, they have active sites, and they remain active to catalyze again.

question: Enzyme sucrase belongs to which one of the following classes?[2022]
question_latex: Enzyme sucrase belongs to which one of the following classes?[2022]
solution: Sucrase is a hydrolase.

question: Sterols are composed of steroid nucleus and ___.[2022]
question_latex: Sterols are composed of steroid nucleus and ___.[2022]
options: D. a long hydrocarbon side chain
answer: D. a long hydrocarbon side chain
solution: Sterols are composed of steroid nucleus and a long hydrocarbon side chain.

question: The lock and key theory of enzyme structure and function was proposed by
question_latex: The lock and key theory of enzyme structure and function was proposed by
solution: Emil Fisher (1894) proposed lock and key theory to explain the mechanism of enzyme action.

question: The steroidal compound found in Dioscorea plant is
question_latex: The steroidal compound found in Dioscorea plant is
solution: Diosgenin is obtained from yam plant ($Dioscorea$).

question: The bond present between two carbohydrate molecules is
question_latex: The bond present between two carbohydrate molecules is
solution: The covalent bond by which monosaccharide molecules link in polymerization is called a glycosidic bond.

question: When the cofactor or coenzyme is removed from the enzyme the remaining part is called ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: When the cofactor or coenzyme is removed from the enzyme the remaining part is called ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The protein part of the enzyme is called Apoenzyme.

question: Polysaccharides are broken down into monosaccharides by ___.[2022]
question_latex: Polysaccharides are broken down into monosaccharides by ___.[2022]
solution: Polysaccharides are broken down into monosaccharides by hydrolysis.

question: Identify whether the given statements are true or false. I. A protozoan contains thousands of organic compounds; II. Concentration of biomolecules in an organism is not fixed.
question_latex: Identify whether the given statements are true or false. I. A protozoan contains thousands of organic compounds; II. Concentration of biomolecules in an organism is not fixed.
solution: Statement II is false. Amount of biomolecules in an organism is fixed.

question: Match the monosaccharide in Column I with its type in Column II. A. Sedoheptulose (III-Heptose); B. Glyceraldehyde (IV-Triose); C. Erythrose (II-Tetrose); D. Galactose (I-Hexose). [2022]
question_latex: Match the monosaccharide in Column I with its type in Column II. A. Sedoheptulose (III-Heptose); B. Glyceraldehyde (IV-Triose); C. Erythrose (II-Tetrose); D. Galactose (I-Hexose). [2022]
options: A. A - III, B - II, C - IV, D - I
B. A - III, B - II, C - I, D - IV
C. A - II, B - IV, C - III, D - IV
solution: A-Heptose(7C), B-Triose(3C), C-Tetrose(4C), D-Hexose(6C).

question: The tightly bound non-proteinaceous organic compound in enzyme, is
question_latex: The tightly bound non-proteinaceous organic compound in enzyme, is
solution: Prosthetic Groups: Organic compound tightly bound to apoenzyme.

question: The tertiary structure of protein containing amino acid cysteine is achieved through
question_latex: The tertiary structure of protein containing amino acid cysteine is achieved through

solution: Cysteines may link to protein together with disulphide bonds.

question: Which one of the following is NOT a conjugated protein? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT a conjugated protein? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Meta protein and peptones are derived proteins which are derived from native proteins by Hydrolysis.

question: Which element is constituent of all amino acids? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which element is constituent of all amino acids? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Nitrogen is constituent of all amino acids as amino acid had COOH at one end and $NH_{2}$ at the other end.

question: Enzymes can react with acidic or basic substances due to their nature. [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Enzymes can react with acidic or basic substances due to their nature. [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Enzymes can react with acidic or basic substances due to their amphoteric nature.

question: Given below is the chemical formula of $CH_{3}(CH_{2})_{14}-C-OH$
question_latex: Given below is the chemical formula of $CH_{3}(CH_{2})_{14}-C-OH$
solution: $CH_{3}(CH_{2})_{14}$COOH is the chemical formula of palmitic acid. It is a saturated fatty acid.

question: Which one of the following sugar does NOT have same empirical formula as that of carbohydrate? [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Which one of the following sugar does NOT have same empirical formula as that of carbohydrate? [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Digitoxose is a deoxy sugar and does not follow the general $(CH_{2}O)_{n}$ formula.

question: Pentoses and hexoses are common ___
question_latex: Pentoses and hexoses are common ___
solution: Pentoses and hexoses are common monosaccharides.

question: Which of the following CANNOT be further hydrolysed into smaller molecules? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following CANNOT be further hydrolysed into smaller molecules? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Monosaccharides cannot be further hydrolyzed into smaller molecules.

solution: a-2C (Acetyl CoA); b-4C (Malate); c-5C ($\alpha$-ketoglutarate); d-6C (Oxalo succinic acid).

question: Which one of the following in NOT an hydrophilic compound?
question_latex: Which one of the following in NOT an hydrophilic compound?
solution: Some amino acids are hydrophilic and some are hydrophobic. Cellulose, hemicelluloses and pectin are hydrophilic.

question: Identify whether the given conditions are anabolic or catabolic. I. Glucose -> Lactic acid; II. Amino acids -> Proteins.
question_latex: Identify whether the given conditions are anabolic or catabolic. I. Glucose $\rightarrow$ Lactic acid; II. Amino acids $\rightarrow$ Proteins.
solution: Glucose is degraded into lactic acid (catabolic). Assembly of a protein from amino acids requires energy (anabolic).

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: As per the Lock and Key model only the correctly sized substrate fits into the keyhole of the Enzyme. Statement-II: As per the induced fit model, approach of a substrate induces a conformational change in the enzyme. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: As per the Lock and Key model only the correctly sized substrate fits into the keyhole of the Enzyme. Statement-II: As per the induced fit model, approach of a substrate induces a conformational change in the enzyme. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
B. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
C. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: Both statement I and statement II are correct with respect to mechanism of enzyme action.

question: Ribozymes are molecules that function as biocatalysts in modern cells
question_latex: Ribozymes are molecules that function as biocatalysts in modern cells
solution: Ribozymes are RNA molecules that functions as biocatalysts in modern cells

question: All monosaccharides are reducing sugars due to presence of free group.

solution: All monosaccharides are reducing sugars due to presence of free aldehyde or ketone group.

solution: Match the columns for simple lipid present in different parts of animal body with their function.

question_latex: Which of the following is a disaccharide?
solution: Sucrose is a disaccharide, which on hydrolysis breaks down into glucose and fructose.

question: Exo-enzymes are generally secreted by ___ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Exo-enzymes are generally secreted by ___ [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Exo-enzymes act outside the cell in which they are synthesized e.g., enzymes released by many fungi.

question: Which amino acid is denoted by symbol F ?
question_latex: Which amino acid is denoted by symbol F ?
solution: Phenylalanine is denoted by F, Proline by P, Tryptophan by W, and Methionine by M.

question: Following are uses of enzymes, EXCEPT
question_latex: Following are uses of enzymes, EXCEPT
options: A. Used as a secondary metabolite
D. Used in extraction of substances
answer: A. Used as a secondary metabolite
solution: Enzymes are functional proteins, not secondary metabolites.

question: Group of substances with greasy consistency and long chain of hydrocarbon containing C, H and O, where hydrogen to oxygen ratio is greater than 2:1, are called
question_latex: Group of substances with greasy consistency and long chain of hydrocarbon containing C, H and O, where hydrogen to oxygen ratio is greater than 2:1, are called
solution: Lipid is a broader term used for fatty acid and their derivatives.

question: Match the terms given in Column I with their respective meaning given in Column II. a. Inhibitors (II); b. Activators (III); c. Coenzymes (I); d. Cofactors (IV). [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match the terms given in Column I with their respective meaning given in Column II. a. Inhibitors (II); b. Activators (III); c. Coenzymes (I); d. Cofactors (IV). [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: a-Inhibitors (reduces activity); b-Activators (increases activity); c-Coenzymes (organic compounds tightly attached); d-Cofactors (loosely attached inorganic ions). [Note: Schema typically defines cofactors as general term, here options used specific mapping].

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: Chemically all living organisms have basic three types of macromolecules (P, C, N). Statement-II: Three types of basic macromolecules present in all living organisms are polymers of simple subunits called monomers. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: Chemically all living organisms have basic three types of macromolecules (P, C, N). Statement-II: Three types of basic macromolecules present in all living organisms are polymers of simple subunits called monomers. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.

C. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: Both statement I and statement II are correct with respect to biomolecules.

question: Holoenzyme is a/an
question_latex: Holoenzyme is a/an
solution: Holoenzyme is an entire conjugated enzyme consisting of a protein component (an apoenzyme) and a non-protein component (a coenzyme or an activator).

question_latex: Select the correct graph which shows the relationship between the rate of an enzymatic activity and substrate concentration

question_latex: Match Column I and Column II with reference to enzymes. A. Transferase (IV-glucokinase); B. Hydrolase (III-sucrase); C. Lyase (I-aldolase); D. Oxidoreductase (II-Alcohol dehydrogenase). [2022]

solution: Transferase-glucokinase, Hydrolase-sucrase, Lyase-aldolase, Oxidoreductase-Alcohol dehydrogenase.

question: Richest source of protein is

solution: Hydrogen bonds hold together the two complementary polynucleotide chains of DNA.

question_latex: The Repeating unit of glycogen is

question: A mathematical explanation for enzyme action on substrate was formulated by
question_latex: A mathematical explanation for enzyme action on substrate was formulated by

answer: A. Leonor Michaelis and Maud Menten
solution: Michaelis and Menten in 1913 gave a mathematical explanation to an enzyme catalyzed reaction.

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component of enzyme by chemical bond. Statement-II: Prosthetic group can be removed from protein part of enzyme by hydrolysis. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component of enzyme by chemical bond. Statement-II: Prosthetic group can be removed from protein part of enzyme by hydrolysis. [MHT-CET 2024]

B. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
C. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
D. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
answer: C. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
solution: The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component by chemical bonds and is not removed by hydrolysis.

question: Which of the following statements are correct for polysaccharides? I. Found in acid insoluble pellet; II. Long chains of sugars; III. Threads with different monosaccharides; IV. Cellulose consist of fructose.

question: Double sugar is

question_latex: Allosteric modulation is due to inhibition action of enzyme by

question: The lock and key model of enzyme action illustrates that a particular enzyme molecule
question_latex: The lock and key model of enzyme action illustrates that a particular enzyme molecule

B. Interacts with a specific type of substrate molecule
